original: Milindapañha
analyzed: milindapañha
translated: The Questions of Milinda

original: Meṇḍakapañha🔽Paṇāmitavagga
analyzed: meṇḍakapañha  paṇāmita vagga

original: 10. Vaṇṇabhaṇanapañha
analyzed: vaṇṇa bhaṇana pañha
translated: The Question about Praising

original: “Bhante nāgasena, bhāsitampetaṁ bhagavatā—
analyzed: bhante nāgasena bhāsitam petam bhagavatā
translated: “Though, revered sir, this was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘mamaṁ vā, bhikkhave, pare vaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ, dhammassa vā, saṅghassa vā vaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ,
analyzed: mamam vā bhikkhave pare vaṇṇam bhāseyyu dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇam bhāseyyu
translated: ‘If, monks, others should praise me, or praise the Dhamma, or praise the Saṅgha,

original: tatra tumhehi na ānando, na somanassaṁ, na cetaso uppilāvitattaṁ karaṇīyan’ti puna
analyzed: tatra tumhehi naḥ ānandaḥ na somanassa na cetasaḥ uppilāvitattam karaṇīyanti puna
translated: you should not rejoice in that, be glad about that, or be uplifted in mind about that,’

original: ca tathāgato selassa brāhmaṇassa yathābhucce vaṇṇe bhaññamāne ānandito sumano uppilāvito
analyzed: ca tathāgataḥ selassa brāhmaṇassa yathābhucce vaṇṇe bhaññamāne ānandito sumanaḥ uppilāvito
translated: and again the Tathāgata, when the true praise of the brahmin Sela was being spoken, rejoiced, was glad, and was uplifted in mind

original: bhiyyo uttariṁ sakaguṇaṁ pakittesi—
analyzed: bhiyyas uttarim saka guṇam pakittesi
translated: and further proclaimed his own special qualities:

original: ‘Rājāhamasmi selāti,
analyzed: rājā aham asmi selāti
translated: ‘I am the king, Sela,

original: dhammarājā anuttaro;
analyzed: dhamma rājā anuttaro
translated: the unsurpassed king of Dhamma;

original: Dhammena cakkaṁ vattemi,
analyzed: dhammena cakkam vattemi
translated: I turn the wheel of Dhamma,

original: cakkaṁ appaṭivattiyan’ti.
analyzed: cakkam appaṭivattiyanti
translated: the wheel that cannot be turned back.’

original: Yadi, bhante nāgasena, bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: yadi bhante nāgasena bhagavatā bhaṇita
translated: If, revered sir, this was said by the Blessed One,

original: ‘mamaṁ vā, bhikkhave, pare vaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ, dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ,
analyzed: mamam vā bhikkhave pare vaṇṇam bhāseyyu dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇam bhāseyyu
translated: ‘If, monks, others should praise me, or praise the Dhamma, or praise the Saṅgha,

original: tatra tumhehi na ānando, na somanassaṁ, na cetaso uppilāvitattaṁ karaṇīyan’ti, tena
analyzed: tatra tumhehi naḥ ānandaḥ na somanassa na cetasaḥ uppilāvitattam karaṇīyanti tena
translated: You should not be joyful, elated, or full of excitement.’

original: hi selassa brāhmaṇassa yathābhucce vaṇṇe bhaññamāne ānandito sumano uppilāvito bhiyyo
analyzed: hi selassa brāhmaṇassa yathābhucce vaṇṇe bhaññamāne ānanditaḥ sumanaḥ uppilāvitaḥ bhiyyas
translated: If, when the brahmin Sela was speaking praise of the Buddha, you were joyful, elated, and full of excitement,

original: uttariṁ sakaguṇaṁ pakittesīti yaṁ vacanaṁ, taṁ micchā.
analyzed: uttarim sakaguṇam pakittesi iti yam tam micchā
translated: and then further proclaimed your own qualities, then you should not have said that.

original: Yadi selassa brāhmaṇassa yathābhucce vaṇṇe bhaññamāne ānandito sumano uppilāvito
analyzed: yadi selassa brāhmaṇassa yathābhucce vaṇṇe bhaññamāne ānandito sumanaḥ uppilāvito
translated: If, when the brahmin Sela was speaking praise of the Buddha, you were joyful, elated, and full of excitement,🔽and then further proclaimed your own qualities, then you should not have said that.

original: bhiyyo uttariṁ sakaguṇaṁ pakittesi, tena hi ‘mamaṁ vā, bhikkhave, pare vaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ,
analyzed: bhiyyas uttarim saka guṇam pakittesi tena hi mamam vā bhikkhave pare vaṇṇam bhāseyyu
translated: If, when others speak praise of me,

original: dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ, tatra tumhehi na ānando, na somanassaṁ,
analyzed: dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇam bhāseyyu tatra tumhehi naḥ ānandaḥ na somanassa
translated: of the Dhamma, or of the Sangha, you should not be joyful, elated,

original: na cetaso uppilāvitattaṁ karaṇīyan’ti tampi vacanaṁ micchā.
analyzed: na vacanam micchā
translated: or full of excitement.’

original: Ayampi ubhato koṭiko pañho tavānuppatto, so tayā nibbāhitabbo”ti.
analyzed: ayam pi ubhatas koṭikaḥ pañho tava anuppatto saḥ tayā nibbāhitabbaḥ ti
translated: This too is a double-pronged question, and you are not able to get out of it.”

original: “Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā—
analyzed: mahā rāja bhagavatā
translated: “Great king, the Buddha did say that,

original: ‘mamaṁ vā, bhikkhave, pare vaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ, dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ, tatra tumhehi na ānando, na somanassaṁ, na cetaso uppilāvitattaṁ karaṇīyan’ti.
analyzed: mamam vā bhikkhave pare vaṇṇam bhāseyyu dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇam bhāseyyu tatra tumhehi naḥ ānandaḥ na somanassa na cetasaḥ uppilāvitattam karaṇīyanti
translated: ‘If others praise me, the Teaching, or the Sangha, you shouldn’t be happy or joyful or elated in your heart.’

original: Selassa ca brāhmaṇassa yathābhucce vaṇṇe bhaññamāne bhiyyo uttariṁ sakaguṇaṁ pakittitaṁ—
analyzed: selassa ca brāhmaṇassa yathābhucce vaṇṇe bhaññamāne bhiyyas uttarim sakaguṇam
translated: And when the brahmin Sela was being praised by the Buddha for his good qualities, he went even further and boasted about his own qualities:

original: ‘Rājāhamasmi selāti,
analyzed: rājā aham asmi selāti
translated: ‘I am the King of Sela,

original: dhammarājā anuttaro;
analyzed: dhamma rājā anuttaro
translated: a supreme king of the Teaching.

original: Dhammena cakkaṁ vattemi,
analyzed: dhammena cakkam vattemi
translated: I turn the wheel of the Teaching,

original: cakkaṁ appaṭivattiyan’ti.
analyzed: cakkam appaṭivattiyanti
translated: a wheel that can’t be turned back.’

original: Paṭhamaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā dhammassa sabhāvasarasalakkhaṇaṁ sabhāvaṁ avitathaṁ bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ tathatthaṁ paridīpayamānena bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: paṭhama mahā rāja bhagavatā dhammassa sabhāva sarasa lakkhaṇam sabhāvam avitatham bhūtam taccham tathattham paridīpayamānena bhaṇita
translated: ‘First, great king, the Buddha said this:

original: ‘mamaṁ vā bhikkhave, pare vaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ, dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ, tatra tumhehi na ānando, na somanassaṁ, na cetaso uppilāvitattaṁ karaṇīyan’ti.
analyzed: mamam vā bhikkhave pare vaṇṇam bhāseyyu dhammassa vā saṅghassa vā vaṇṇam bhāseyyu tatra tumhehi naḥ ānandaḥ na somanassa na cetasaḥ uppilāvitattam karaṇīyanti
translated: “If others praise me, the Teaching, or the Sangha, you shouldn’t be happy or joyful or elated in your heart.”

original: Yaṁ pana bhagavatā selassa brāhmaṇassa yathābhucce vaṇṇe bhaññamāne bhiyyo uttariṁ sakaguṇaṁ pakittitaṁ—
analyzed: yam pana bhagavatā selassa brāhmaṇassa yathābhucce vaṇṇe bhaññamāne bhiyyas uttarim saka guṇam
translated: But when the Blessed One, while the true praise of the brahmin Sela was being spoken, further proclaimed his own special qualities,

original: ‘rājāhamasmi selāti, dhammarājā anuttaro’ti taṁ na lābhahetu, na yasahetu, na attahetu,
analyzed: rājā aham asmi dhamma rājā tam na lābha hetu na yasa hetu na atta hetu
translated: that was not for the sake of gain, not for the sake of fame, not for the sake of self,

original: na pakkhahetu, na antevāsikamyatāya, atha kho anukampāya kāruññena hitavasena evaṁ
analyzed: na pakkha hetu na antevāsi kamyatāya atha kho anukampāya kāruññena hita vasena eva
translated: not for the sake of a faction, not out of love for a pupil, but out of compassion, out of mercy, out of a desire for their welfare,

original: imassa dhammābhisamayo bhavissati tiṇṇañca māṇavakasatānanti, evaṁ bhiyyo uttariṁ sakaguṇaṁ bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: imassa dhamma abhisamayaḥ bhavissati tiṇṇam ca māṇavaka satānam ti evam bhiyyas uttarim saka guṇam
translated: thinking: ‘There will be a penetration of the Dhamma for these three hundred youths.’ Thus he further proclaimed his own special qualities,

original: ‘rājāhamasmi selāti, dhammarājā anuttaro’”ti.
analyzed: rājā aham asmi dhamma rājā
translated: saying: ‘I am a king, O Sela, a king of Dhamma, unsurpassed.’“

original: “Sādhu, bhante nāgasena, evametaṁ tathā sampaṭicchāmī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante nāgasena evam etam tathā sampaṭicchāmi iti
translated: “Excellent, revered Nāgasena; so it is, therefore do I accept this explanation.”

original: Vaṇṇabhaṇanapañho dasamo.
analyzed: vaṇṇa bhaṇana pañhaḥ dasamaḥ
translated: The tenth chapter.
